predictions.text: Ofcom will publish a public consultation, call for evidence, or formal report that explicitly discusses requiring or enabling access to end-to-end encrypted communications (e.g., “backdoors,” “exceptional access,” “technical capability notices,” or equivalent language) for at least one major messaging platform, by 2026-06-30.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verified if an Ofcom document posted on ofcom.org.uk (consultation, call for evidence, discussion paper, report, or statement) within the deadline explicitly addresses compelled/mandated access to E2EE or “technical capability” measures for encrypted services.
evidence: UK ordered Ofcom to explore encryption backdoors, escalating the security-vs-privacy fight and increasing compliance uncertainty for messaging platforms and cloud providers. (reclaimthenet.org, 2026-01-10)
monitoring_signals: Ofcom consultations page updates mentioning encryption, E2EE, online safety, technical capability notices
UK Home Office statements on encrypted messaging access
Coverage by BBC/Reuters/FT on Ofcom encryption proposals
predictions.rationale: A directive to explore backdoors typically produces a public Ofcom paper or consultation within months as part of process legitimacy and stakeholder input.

predictions.text: FinCEN (U.S. Treasury) will issue a public advisory, alert, or guidance document specifically addressing fraud/scams involving cryptocurrency ATMs (bitcoin ATMs), by 2026-06-30.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verified if FinCEN.gov posts an advisory/alert/guidance referencing “virtual currency kiosks,” “cryptocurrency ATMs,” “bitcoin ATMs,” or equivalent, focused on consumer fraud/scams, within the deadline.
evidence: Crypto ATMs face tightening U.S. scrutiny over fraud, threatening a niche on-ramp and signaling broader consumer-protection regulation of retail crypto infrastructure. (cnbc.com, 2026-01-10)
monitoring_signals: FinCEN advisories feed and press releases
State AG/regulator actions against crypto ATM operators
FTC Consumer Sentinel spikes in crypto ATM scam reports
predictions.rationale: When a scam vector becomes prominent, FinCEN often responds with an advisory to guide bank/MSB compliance and SAR filing.

predictions.text: Either the U.S. House Financial Services Committee or the U.S. Senate Banking Committee will hold a hearing where the official title or witness testimony explicitly focuses on cryptocurrency ATMs (bitcoin ATMs) and fraud/scams, by 2026-09-30.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verified if a hearing occurs by the deadline and the committee’s official hearing page (or the published transcript/opening statements) explicitly references “cryptocurrency ATMs/bitcoin ATMs/virtual currency kiosks” as a focus area.
evidence: Crypto ATMs face tightening U.S. scrutiny over fraud, threatening a niche on-ramp and signaling broader consumer-protection regulation of retail crypto infrastructure. (cnbc.com, 2026-01-10)
monitoring_signals: House Financial Services and Senate Banking hearing schedules
Introduced bills targeting crypto kiosks / MSB kiosk requirements
GAO reports or CFPB/FTC testimony referencing crypto ATM scams
predictions.rationale: Rising consumer fraud narratives frequently trigger committee hearings, especially if state actions and press coverage continue.

predictions.text: The U.S. FDA will accept for review (i.e., “filing accepted”) at least one New Drug Application (NDA) for an oral GLP-1 (or GLP-1/GIP) drug for chronic weight management (obesity indication), with a publicly stated PDUFA/target action date, by 2026-12-31.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verified if FDA acceptance is publicly confirmed via a company press release/SEC filing and includes a PDUFA/target action date for an oral GLP-1(-class) obesity indication, or appears on an official FDA filing/communications reference by the deadline.
evidence: 2026 could be a breakout year for oral obesity drugs, intensifying GLP-1 competition and reshaping pharma revenues, payer costs, and long-term healthcare utilization. (cnbc.com, 2026-01-10)
monitoring_signals: Novo Nordisk/Eli Lilly trial readouts and regulatory-submission statements
FDA drug application acceptance announcements
Payer/formulary commentary referencing anticipated oral obesity launches
predictions.rationale: The competitive push into oral obesity therapies makes at least one NDA acceptance plausible within a year, even if approval may come later.

predictions.text: TrendForce (or DRAMeXchange) will report that contract prices for HBM (HBM3/HBM3E or equivalent) increased by at least 10% in 2026 Q2 versus 2026 Q1, in a report published by 2026-07-31.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verified if TrendForce/DRAMeXchange publishes a Q2-vs-Q1 contract price change figure (or index) for HBM showing +10% or more, by the deadline.
evidence: AI memory (HBM) is effectively sold out, driving price spikes and reinforcing hardware bottlenecks that can constrain AI deployment timelines and margins. (cnbc.com, 2026-01-10)
monitoring_signals: TrendForce HBM pricing notes and quarterly DRAM/HBM outlooks
SK hynix/Samsung/Micron commentary on tight HBM supply and pricing
GPU/accelerator shipment constraints attributed to HBM availability
predictions.rationale: Sold-out conditions and capacity constraints typically translate into measurable contract-price step-ups in the next quarter.

predictions.text: At least one of Micron, Samsung Electronics, or SK hynix will increase (raise) its previously issued FY2026 (or 2026 calendar-year) capital expenditure guidance by at least $2.0B (USD-equivalent), explicitly citing HBM/AI-memory capacity expansion, by 2026-09-30.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verified if a company raises capex guidance by ≥$2.0B vs prior guidance in an earnings release/call transcript/SEC filing and explicitly links the increase to HBM/AI-memory expansion, by the deadline.
evidence: AI memory (HBM) is effectively sold out, driving price spikes and reinforcing hardware bottlenecks that can constrain AI deployment timelines and margins. (cnbc.com, 2026-01-10)
monitoring_signals: Earnings calls mentioning incremental HBM capex or accelerated tool installs
Supplier commentary (ASML/Applied/Lam) on memory-related demand
Government subsidy announcements tied to advanced memory capacity
predictions.rationale: Sustained HBM tightness often forces suppliers to accelerate spending; guidance step-ups are a common mechanism once visibility improves.

predictions.text: The U.S. State Department will authorize ordered departure (or otherwise direct non-emergency U.S. government personnel to depart) from at least one U.S. diplomatic post in the Middle East, explicitly citing heightened regional tensions involving Iran, by 2026-03-31.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verified if travel.state.gov (or an official embassy notice/State press statement) announces ordered departure/non-emergency departure authorization referencing Iran-related threats or heightened tensions, by the deadline.
evidence: Trump was briefed on options to strike Iran, raising odds of U.S.-Iran escalation amid internal Iranian turmoil and uncertain Western contingency planning. (nytimes.com, 2026-01-10)
Iran unrest is being fueled by currency collapse and inflation, turning an economic crisis into nationwide political instability with regional spillover risks. (nytimes.com, 2026-01-10)
monitoring_signals: U.S. embassy security alerts mentioning Iran-backed threats
CENTCOM force-protection posture changes
Commercial airline advisories about Gulf-region risk levels
predictions.rationale: Ordered departures are a common early, verifiable signal when Washington assesses near-term escalation or threat to facilities.

predictions.text: Iran will implement a nationwide fuel-price or rationing-policy change (e.g., raising the official gasoline price tier(s) or tightening quotas) that is publicly confirmed by an official Iranian government source or a major wire service (Reuters/AP/AFP), by 2026-06-30.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verified if an official Iranian government announcement (or Reuters/AP/AFP citing official confirmation) reports a nationwide gasoline price increase or rationing/quota tightening by the deadline.
evidence: Iran unrest is being fueled by currency collapse and inflation, turning an economic crisis into nationwide political instability with regional spillover risks. (nytimes.com, 2026-01-10)
monitoring_signals: Iran budget statements and subsidy reforms
Reports of fuel shortages/lines and provincial unrest triggers
Parliament or cabinet discussions of energy-subsidy adjustments
predictions.rationale: Fiscal stress and inflation often push subsidy reforms; fuel policy is a high-impact lever that frequently triggers (and responds to) social instability.

predictions.text: The European Commission (or the European Investment Bank/EIF under an EU mandate) will announce financing/guarantees/grants totaling at least €200 million for a Greenland-based critical-minerals project (mining, processing, or enabling infrastructure), by 2026-12-31.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verified if an EU or EIB/EIF press release states ≥€200M total support for a Greenland critical-minerals project, with Greenland explicitly named as the project location, by the deadline.
evidence: Trump’s renewed Greenland interest is pushing Europe toward negotiation strategies, highlighting Arctic security and critical-minerals competition. (nytimes.com, 2026-01-10)
monitoring_signals: EU Global Gateway / raw materials partnership announcements mentioning Greenland
EIB project database entries tagged Greenland/mining/critical minerals
Danish/EU joint statements on Arctic strategic minerals supply chains
predictions.rationale: European strategic-minerals policy is intensifying, but Greenland projects face permitting/politics; large EU-ticket support is possible but not base-case.
